sub_title: Professor Designing Value Networks, The Hague University of Applied Sciences, PhD
summary:
Experience in Creativity Management in the Leisure Sector.	•	Designing and implementing creativity development and management strategies for the relevant target groups in the Leisure Sector of the Municipality of Teteven, Bulgaria under the PHARE programme (2005-2006); of the Municipality of Belogradchik, Bulgaria (2006-2007) under the Active Labour Market Services Programme; of the Region of Targoviste, Bulgaria (2007-2008) under the Active Labour Market Services Programme; of the Region of Kyustendil, Bulgaria (2007) under the Active Labour Market Services.
•	Elaborating the National Strategy for Sustainable Tourism Development of the State Tourism Agency (2008).
•	Elaborating the Creativity Management Strategies of the Bulgarian Hotel and Restaurant Association, the National Tourism Research Institute, local and regional NGOs and tourism service providers.
Experience in designing interactive short-term training programmes for relevant target groups, based on incorporation of innovative approaches to adult training (interactive workshops, result-oriented education, learning-by-doing, role playing techniques, on-the-job training techniques, distance learning tools, etc.
Experience in drafting training curricula based on the incorporation of above-mentioned principles.	•	From 2008 to 2010 involved as Key Expert in the PHARE Technical Assistance project (2008) with WYG International and WYG Bulgaria for the development of training curricula and development of state educational standards for 30 vocations and training of 400 teachers in all the 6 planning regions of Bulgaria in New Technologies in Education and Training as well as in Interactive Training Methodologies and Result-Oriented Education. 
Experience in setting up new training institutions (training centres, NGOs, etc.) for short-term vocational training, including business planning and ensuring their sustainable operations.
